data.text:
Draft format only.
You can use agendas from all factions in this deck.
data.title: The Shadow: Pulling the Strings
data.flavor: The Past is the Future.

data.text: Draft format only.
data.title: The Masque: Cyber General
data.flavor: "This war is far from over."

data.text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [anarch] cards installed than any other faction, whenever you trash a Corp card, shuffle the top card of your heap into your stack.
data.title: Wyvern: Chemically Enhanced
Boris "Syfr" Kovac: Crafty Veteran
data.text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [criminal] cards installed than any other faction, when your turn begins, remove 1 tag.

data.title: Jamie "Bzzz" Micken: Techno Savant
data.text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [shaper] cards installed than any other faction, when you install a card the first time each turn, draw 1 card.

data.title: Strategic Innovations: Future Forward
data.text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [haas-bioroid] cards rezzed than any other faction, when the Runner's turn ends, shuffle 1 card in Archives into R&D.

Draft format only.
If you have more [jinteki] cards rezzed than any other faction, when your turn begins, you may swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
data.title: Synthetic Systems: The World Re-imagined

data.text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [nbn] cards rezzed than any other faction, whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, give the runner 1 tag.
data.title: Information Dynamics: All You Need To Know
Fringe Applications: Tomorrow, Today
data.text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [weyland-consortium] cards rezzed than any other faction, when the Runner's turn begins, place an advancement token on a piece of ice.
Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
data.title: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire
data.flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."
Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
data.text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
data.title: Déjà Vu
Demolition Run
data.text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
data.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

data.title: Stimhack
data.text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.

data.flavor: I feel almost naked without it
data.title: Cyberfeeder
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.

data.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard
data.text: +2[mu] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Grimoire

data.flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru
data.text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Corroder

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
data.title: Datasucker

data.text: Djinn can host up to 3[mu] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [click], 1[credit]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Djinn

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.
data.title: Medium
data.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.
November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
data.title: Mimic

data.text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.
data.title: Parasite

data.text:
3[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength.
1[credit]: Ice has -1 strength.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Wyrm
data.flavor: Fire and ichor…

data.title: Yog.0
data.text: 0[credit]: Break code gate subroutine.
data.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!

In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
data.title: Ice Carver
data.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.

data.title: Wyldside
data.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [click].
data.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
"Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
data.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[credit], then you gain 2[credit] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.
data.title: Account Siphon

data.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
data.title: Easy Mark
data.text: Gain 3[credit].

data.title: Forged Activation Orders
data.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
data.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
"Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
data.title: Inside Job
data.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.

data.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
data.title: Special Order
data.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
[click], 1[credit]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
data.title: Lemuria Codecracker
data.flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago

data.title: Desperado
data.text: +1[mu] Gain 1[credit] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.

data.title: Aurora
data.text: 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.

data.title: Femme Fatale
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength.
data.title: Ninja
data.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.

data.text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
data.title: Sneakdoor Beta
data.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

data.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
data.title: Bank Job

data.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
data.title: Crash Space
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
Forfeit an agenda, [click]: Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Data Dealer
data.flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.

"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."
data.text: [trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
data.title: Decoy
Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker
data.text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
data.flavor: "Are you listening?"

data.text: Draw 3 cards.
data.title: Diesel
data.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
data.title: Modded
data.text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
data.title: The Maker's Eye
data.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
"There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
data.title: Tinkering
data.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.

data.title: Akamatsu Mem Chip
data.flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
It's not endless, it just feels that way.
data.title: Rabbit Hole
data.text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.

data.title: The Personal Touch
data.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
data.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…

data.text: +2[mu] +2[link] 2[recurring-credit] Use the credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: The Toolbox

data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Battering Ram
data.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Gordian Blade
data.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.

data.title: Magnum Opus
data.text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
data.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused
data.text: 1[credit]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.
data.title: Net Shield
Pipeline
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

data.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
data.title: Aesop's Pawnshop
Sacrificial Construct
data.text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
data.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
"Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
data.title: Infiltration
data.text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Sure Gamble
data.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
data.title: Crypsis

data.text: +1[link]
data.title: Access to Globalsec
data.flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay…
Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
data.title: Armitage Codebusting
data.text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.

data.title: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future
data.text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[credit].
data.flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.

data.text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.
data.title: Accelerated Beta Test

data.text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
data.title: Adonis Campaign
Aggressive Secretary
data.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

data.title: Archived Memories
data.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
data.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"

"Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
data.title: Biotic Labor
data.text: Gain [click][click].

data.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
data.title: Shipment from MirrorMorph
data.text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).

The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Heimdall 1.0
data.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Ichi 1.0

data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Viktor 1.0
data.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
Whrrrrr!
data.title: Rototurret
data.text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: "I solve problems."
data.text: X[credit], [trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
data.title: Corporate Troubleshooter

data.text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
data.title: Experiential Data
data.flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.

data.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

data.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
data.title: Nisei MK II
Project Junebug
data.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.

data.title: Snare!
data.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.

data.title: Zaibatsu Loyalty
data.text:
If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty.
1[credit] or [trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.

data.title: Neural EMP
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.
data.title: Precognition
data.text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.

data.flavor: "Where does it go?"
data.title: Cell Portal
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.

data.title: Chum
data.text: [subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.
data.flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

data.title: Data Mine
data.text: [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
data.flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n

Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
data.title: Neural Katana
data.text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.

data.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
data.title: Wall of Thorns
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.
data.title: Akitaro Watanabe
data.text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.

2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
data.title: NBN: Making News
data.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.

data.title: AstroScript Pilot Program
data.text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced. Limit 1 per deck. Errata from FAQ 3.1

When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.
When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.
data.title: Breaking News

data.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
data.title: Anonymous Tip
data.text: Draw 3 cards.

Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
data.title: Closed Accounts

data.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Psychographics
data.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: SEA Source
data.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

data.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
data.title: Ghost Branch
Data Raven
data.text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.

data.flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.
data.title: Matrix Analyzer
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

data.title: Tollbooth
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."

data.title: Red Herrings
data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.

data.flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."
data.title: SanSan City Grid
data.text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.

data.flavor: Moving Upwards.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
data.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
Hostile Takeover
data.text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
data.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

data.title: Posted Bounty
data.text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
data.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."

data.text: [click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4[credit].
data.title: Security Subcontract
data.flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." -Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security

data.title: Aggressive Negotiation
data.text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."

data.title: Beanstalk Royalties
data.text: Gain 3[credit].
data.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.

data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
data.title: Scorched Earth
data.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"

data.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
data.title: Shipment from Kaguya
data.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

data.text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Archer
data.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

data.text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Hadrian's Wall
data.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru
"I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
data.text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Ice Wall
Shadow
data.text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

data.title: Research Station
data.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
data.flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."
"If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
data.title: Priority Requisition
data.text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.

data.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."
data.title: Private Security Force

data.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
data.title: Melange Mining Corp.
data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].

data.title: PAD Campaign
data.text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
data.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.

data.text: Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Hedge Fund
data.flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
data.title: Enigma
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Hunter
data.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR

data.title: Wall of Static
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
"Running is the ultimate game, and I get to make all the rules."
data.text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
data.title: Whizzard: Master Gamer

data.title: Efficiency Committee
Project Wotan
data.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.

data.title: Sentinel Defense Program
data.text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas
The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.
data.text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
data.title: Alix T4LB07
Cerebral Overwriter
data.text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.

You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
data.title: Director Haas

data.text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [click], hosted advancement token: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Haas Arcology AI

data.flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.
data.text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
data.title: Thomas Haas

data.text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
data.title: Bioroid Efficiency Research

data.flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
data.title: Successful Demonstration
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[credit].

The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Heimdall 2.0
data.flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.

data.text: [subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
data.title: Howler
data.flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru

data.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Ichi 2.0
data.flavor: The game has changed.

data.title: Minelayer
data.text: [subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
data.flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.

data.title: Viktor 2.0
data.text: The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Zed 1.0

data.text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[credit], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
data.title: Awakening Center

data.text: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez Tyr's Hand. [trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.
data.title: Tyr's Hand

data.flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
data.text: [click], [click]: Gain 3[credit].
data.title: Gila Hands Arcology

data.flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru
data.text: [click], 1[credit]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Levy University

data.text:
Gain 2[credit] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
data.title: Server Diagnostics
data.flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."

The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Bastion

data.flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Datapike

data.flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
data.title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman
data.text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.

data.flavor: "New technology destroys the old."
data.text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
data.title: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge
Exile: Streethawk
data.text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
data.flavor: "I can make that work."

data.title: Escher
data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.

data.flavor: Wheeeee!
data.title: Exploratory Romp
data.text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.

data.flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
data.text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[credit] for each program trashed.
data.title: Freelance Coding Contract
Scavenge
data.text:
Trash an installed program.
If you do, install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.flavor: One man's trash.
Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
data.title: Levy AR Lab Access
data.text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.

+3[mu] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[credit]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Monolith
Feedback Filter
data.text:
3[credit]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
data.flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.

data.text: [trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
data.title: Clone Chip
data.flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.

data.title: Omni-drive
data.text:
Omni-drive can host a single program of 1[mu] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.

data.flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
data.text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
data.title: Atman

data.flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
data.title: Cloak

data.flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant
data.title: Dagger
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

data.title: Chakana
data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.

data.title: Cyber-Cypher
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.

data.flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
data.title: Paricia
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash assets.
2[credit], [trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Self-modifying Code
data.flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." -The Professor

data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
data.title: Sahasrara
data.flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.
"The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
data.title: Inti
data.text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
[click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
data.title: Professional Contacts
data.flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.
data.text:
+1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
data.title: Borrowed Satellite

data.flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
data.title: Ice Analyzer
data.text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.

data.title: Dirty Laundry
data.text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.
data.flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
"We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.
data.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
data.title: Daily Casts

data.flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
data.title: Same Old Thing
data.text: [click], [click], [trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).

data.flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
data.text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[credit].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
data.title: The Source

data.flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Frame Job

data.text: [click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run while Pawn is hosted on a piece of ice, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs. Errata from FAQ 3.0.1
data.title: Pawn
Rook
data.text: [click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.

As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Hostage

data.flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.
data.text:
Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[credit] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[click], [trash]: Gain 1[credit] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
data.title: Gorman Drip v1

data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.
data.title: Lockpick
data.flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
data.title: False Echo
data.flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler

data.text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
data.title: Motivation
data.flavor: Normal people-sane people-do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
"I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
data.title: John Masanori
data.text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Project Ares
data.flavor: Who wants to start a war?
NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
data.title: NEXT Bronze
data.text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
data.title: Celebrity Gift

data.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
data.title: Himitsu-Bako
data.text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor
data.text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
data.title: Character Assassination

data.flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."
data.title: Jackson Howard
data.text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives to R&D.

As additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Invasion of Privacy

data.text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Geothermal Fracking
data.flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.

data.text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the Runner pays 3[credit]." for each advancement token on it.
data.title: Swarm

data.flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?
data.title: Cyberdex Trial
data.text: Purge virus counters.

data.flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor
data.text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Grim

data.text: [click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server. Host ice has -2 strength.
data.title: Bishop

data.flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.
data.title: Scheherazade
data.text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[credit].

data.flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] and lose [click].
data.title: Hard at Work

data.text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.
data.title: Recon
data.flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.

data.title: Copycat
data.text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from the new position).
data.flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.

data.title: Leviathan
data.text: 3[credit]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 3[credit]: +5 strength.
data.flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 10[credit], if able; otherwise, trash it.
data.title: Eureka!
data.flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards you may choose 1 faceup card from Archives and add it to the top of R&D.
data.title: Record Reconstructor
data.flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor

A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
data.text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to play events.
data.title: Prepaid VoicePAD

data.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.
data.title: Wotan

data.text:
Play only if the Runner installed a resource during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Hellion Alpha Test

data.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthanasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma
data.text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Clone Retirement
Swordsman
data.text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.

data.title: Shipment from SanSan
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.

data.title: Muckraker
data.text:
When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

data.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
data.title: The Cleaners
data.text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.

data.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
data.title: Elizabeth Mills
data.text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.

data.title: Off the Grid
data.text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.

data.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
data.text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[credit] for each bad publicity taken.
data.title: Profiteering

data.flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".
data.title: Restructure
data.text: Gain 15[credit].
The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
data.title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter
data.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

data.title: Deep Red
data.text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [click] ability without spending [click]. Limit 1 console per player.

data.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
data.title: Knight
data.text: 2[credit]: Break subroutine on host ice. [click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.

As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.
data.title: Running Interference

data.text: [click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
data.title: Expert Schedule Analyzer
data.flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.

data.text: When your turn ends, gain 1[credit] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
data.title: Grifter
data.flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.

The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Torch

data.flavor: Looks can be deceiving.
data.title: Woman in the Red Dress
data.text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.

data.flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
data.title: Raymond Flint
data.text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[trash]: Expose 1 card.

data.flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
data.title: Isabel McGuire
data.text: [click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.

data.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
data.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
data.title: Hudson 1.0

data.flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
data.text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
data.title: Accelerated Diagnostics

data.text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
data.title: Unorthodox Predictions
Sundew
data.text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1[click] on his or her turn, gain 2[credit] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.
data.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
data.text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[credit].
data.title: City Surveillance
Snoop
data.text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.

data.title: Ireress
data.text: Ireress gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit]" for each bad publicity you have.
data.flavor: Say it really fast.

data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less. X is equal to or less than the highest install cost among all installed programs and pieces of hardware.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: Power Shutdown

data.flavor: It folds under pressure.
data.title: Paper Wall
data.text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.title: Interns
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
data.flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.
data.title: Keyhole
data.text: [click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.

data.title: Activist Support
data.text:
When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags.
When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.
data.flavor: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja
Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.
data.title: Lawyer Up
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.

data.flavor: "Care to have a look?"
data.title: Leverage
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.
1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Garrote
data.flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.

data.text: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.
data.title: LLDS Processor
data.flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"

data.title: Sharpshooter
data.text: [trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[credit]: +2 strength.
data.flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor
"Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor
data.text: [click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.
data.title: Capstone

data.flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."
data.text: When your turn begins, lose [click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.
data.title: Starlight Crusade Funding

data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[credit].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.
data.title: Rex Campaign

data.text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Fenris
data.flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.

data.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1[credit]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
data.title: Panic Button
data.flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.

data.title: Shock!
data.text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.

data.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
data.title: Tsurugi
data.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

data.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
data.title: TGTBT
data.text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.

data.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
data.title: Sweeps Week
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each card in the Runner's grip.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.
data.title: RSVP
data.flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.

[subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.
data.text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Curtain Wall

data.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
data.title: Punitive Counterstrike
data.text:
<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

data.title: Veterans Program
data.text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.
data.flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
data.title: Quest Completed
data.flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
data.title: Hemorrhage

data.flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.
data.text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.
data.title: Tallie Perrault

data.flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette
data.title: Executive Wiretaps
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.

data.title: Blackguard
data.text: +2[mu] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.
data.flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.

"CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
data.title: CyberSolutions Mem Chip

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.
data.title: Alpha
data.flavor: The beginning…
…and the end?
data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.
data.title: Omega
Blackmail
data.text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.

data.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
data.title: Blue Level Clearance
Strongbox
data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.

data.title: Toshiyuki Sakai
data.text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.

data.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Yagura

data.flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.
data.title: Restoring Face
data.text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.

data.title: Market Research
data.text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.

data.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
data.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Wraparound

data.flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
data.text: You start the game with 10[credit] and 1 bad publicity.
data.title: GRNDL: Power Unleashed
Vulcan Coverup
data.text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.
data.flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."

data.title: GRNDL Refinery
data.text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
data.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

data.title: Subliminal Messaging
data.text:
Gain 1[credit]. Gain [click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.

As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).
data.title: Singularity
Queen's Gambit
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.
data.title: Dyson Fractal Generator
data.flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori

data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using killers.
data.title: Silencer
data.flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage

data.title: Savoir-faire
data.text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[credit]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.
data.flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago

data.title: Fall Guy
data.text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
data.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.

data.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Gain 2[credit]. Gain an additional 1[credit] for each double event in your heap.
data.title: Power Nap
data.flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory
"Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
data.text: [click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
data.title: Paintbrush
Lucky Find
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Gain 9[credit].
data.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.

data.title: Gyri Labyrinth
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the beginning of the Corp's next turn.
data.flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.

data.title: Reclamation Order
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.

data.title: Broadcast Square
data.text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, <trace>trace 3</trace> if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
data.flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.

data.title: Corporate Shuffle
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
data.flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Being replaced by an android.

data.text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
data.title: Caprice Nisei
data.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.

data.title: Shinobi
data.text:
When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.

data.title: Marker
data.text: [subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
data.flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.title: Hive
data.text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.title: Witness Tampering
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.
data.flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."

data.title: NAPD Contract
data.text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[credit].

data.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
data.title: Quandary
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: Evolving a Better You.
data.title: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer
data.text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.

data.title: Nisei Division: The Next Generation
data.text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[credit].
data.flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.

data.text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
data.title: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within
House of Knives
data.text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.

data.title: Medical Breakthrough
data.text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
data.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."

data.title: Philotic Entanglement
data.text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.

When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
data.title: The Future Perfect
Chairman Hiro
data.text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

data.title: Mental Health Clinic
data.text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
data.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.

data.text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
data.title: Psychic Field
Shi.Kyū
data.text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[credit]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.

data.flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
data.title: Tenma Line
data.text: [click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.

data.title: Cerebral Cast
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.

data.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."
data.text: Gain 8[credit]. The Runner gains 3[credit].
data.title: Medical Research Fundraiser
Mushin No Shin
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.

data.title: Inazuma
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
data.flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.

data.title: Komainu
data.text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

data.flavor: Yip Yip!
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
data.title: Pup

data.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
data.title: Shiro

data.text: [subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-no-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
data.title: Susanoo-no-Mikoto
data.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.

data.text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: NeoTokyo Grid
data.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.

data.title: Tori Hanzō
data.text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[credit] to do 1 brain damage.
data.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.

data.title: Plan B
data.text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.

data.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
data.title: Guard
data.text:
