You may forfeit an agenda to rez Tithonium instead of paying its rez cost.
Tithonium cannot host cards.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 resource and end the run.
Turn an agenda faceup and install Transparency Initiative on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host agenda gains public. Whenever you advance host agenda, gain 1[credit]."
data.title: Transparency Initiative

data.text: Install Rover Algorithm on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice has +1 strength for each power counter on Rover Algorithm. Whenever the Runner passes host ice, place 1 power counter on Rover Algorithm."
data.title: Rover Algorithm
Mining Accident
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
The Corp must pay 5[credit] or take 1 bad publicity. Remove Mining Accident from the game instead of trashing it.

data.title: Respirocytes
data.text:
When you install Respirocytes, suffer 1 meat damage.
The first time you have 0 cards in your grip each turn, draw 1 card and place a power counter on Respirocytes. When Respirocytes has 3 or more power counters on it, trash it.

data.flavor: Vanadis, a Martian arms manufacturer, was among the first sites targeted from orbit during the war.
data.title: Salvaged Vanadis Armory
data.text:
[trash]: The Corp trashes the top X cards of R&D. X is the amount of damage you have suffered this turn. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after suffering any amount of damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>

Whenever you expose a card or access cards and do not steal or trash any of them, place 1 virus counter on Aumakua.
Aumakua has +1 strength for each virus counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
data.title: Aumakua

data.flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.
data.title: Caldera
data.text: 3[credit]: Prevent 1 net or brain damage.
Make a run. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may install a program from your grip, ignoring all costs. When this run ends, trash all programs installed using Diana's Hunt.
data.title: Diana's Hunt

data.flavor: "I wield the power cosmic - a galactic force that can reshape the Net!" -S'onge Galaxy
data.title: Reshape
data.text: Swap 2 pieces of unrezzed ice.

data.flavor: "Aptly named." -g00ru
data.title: Dummy Box
data.text: Trash a card from your grip: Prevent an installed card of the same type from being trashed by the Corp.

data.title: Corporate Defector
data.text: Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw a card (not through a card effect), reveal that card.
data.flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.
"Sure, we also use human labor - they are more easily replaced." -Emil Merk
data.text: When you score CFC Excavation Contract, gain 2[credit] for each rezzed bioroid.
data.title: CFC Excavation Contract
MCA Austerity Policy
data.text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on MCA Austerity Policy. When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
[click],[trash], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click],[click],[click],[click].

data.title: Restore
data.text: Install and rez 1 card from Archives (paying all costs). Remove all other copies of that card in Archives from the game.

data.title: Breached Dome
data.text:
If Breached Dome is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Breached Dome, do 1 meat damage and trash the top card of the stack.

data.flavor: By the time the data storm passed, the landscape was transformed, and she was hopelessly lost.
data.title: Sand Storm
data.text: [subroutine] Move Sand Storm so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server). Trash Sand Storm.
The first time the Runner trashes a Corp card each turn, give him or her 1 tag.
data.title: AR-Enhanced Security
data.flavor: Only NBN's sec teams were outfitted with systems that could read data flows and see into the Net.

data.title: Rolling Brownout
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The play cost of each operation and event is increased by 1. The first time the Runner plays an event each turn, gain 1[credit].

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag for each tag he or she has; if the Runner has no tags, give him or her 1 tag.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
data.title: Threat Level Alpha

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a piece of ice from HQ protecting a remote server (ignoring all costs). Place 3 advancement tokens on that ice.
data.title: Priority Construction

data.text: Each time all the subroutines are broken on a piece of ice protecting this server, trash the top 2 cards of the stack.
data.title: Fractal Threat Matrix
data.flavor: "I embedded recursive data loops into the go-no-go subroutines of every piece of ice." -Anson Rose

data.text: Conundrum has +3 strength if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed program. [subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Conundrum
data.flavor: A ghost image of it could be made out in the static of his BMI. He hoped never to run across the real thing again.

data.title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter
data.text: The first time each turn that you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap, if able. The Corp removes 1 from the game; the other is added to your grip.

data.flavor: "Bypassing a system's defenses by cutting physical wires is what I like to call old school." - Steve Cambridge
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Derez a piece of ice that has a rez cost of X or lower.
data.title: Brute-Force-Hack

data.text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
data.title: Spear Phishing
data.flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.
data.title: SYN Attack
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.
+1[mu], +1[link] The first time each turn you pass all of the ice protecting HQ, you may draw 1 card to force the Corp to draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Polyhistor

data.flavor: "Technology breeds crime."
data.title: Abagnale
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.

data.flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of sentry ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Lustig.
data.title: Lustig

data.flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.
data.title: Demara

data.text: Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. When your turn begins, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Mammon. When your turn ends, remove all hosted power counters.
data.title: Mammon

data.flavor: Know your mark, their weaknesses and strengths--both will show how to best bypass their defenses.
data.title: Charlatan
data.text: [click], [click]: Make a run. The first time you approach a rezzed piece of ice during this run, you may pay credits equal to the strength of that ice to bypass it.

+1[link]
[trash]: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only if you made a successful run on HQ during this turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>.
data.title: Maxwell James
data.flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.

data.text:
Before drawing your starting hand, look at the top 6 cards of your stack. Set 4 of them facedown, as NVRAM. Shuffle the rest into your stack.
[click]: Add 1 card from NVRAM to your grip.
data.title: Ayla "Bios" Rahim: Simulant Specialist

data.flavor: Each AI had been tasked with finding a solution to the same problem but with different variables.
data.title: Careful Planning
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a card in or protecting a remote server. That card cannot be rezzed this turn.

data.title: Deep Data Mining
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 1 additional card for each unused MU up to 4.
data.flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.
It is not literally made of diamonds, but it is worth several times its weight in them.
data.title: LLDS Memory Diamond
data.text:
+1[mu], +1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.

data.title: Ubax
data.text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
data.flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios

data.title: Adept
data.text: Adept has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break sentry or barrier subroutine.
data.flavor: Μεγάλο μέρος της μάθησης δεν διδάσκει την κατανόηση

data.text: Savant has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break 1 sentry or 2 code gate subroutines.
data.title: Savant
data.flavor: Δεν υπἁρχει τίποτα μόνιμο, εκτός από την αλλαγή.

data.text: Install Egret only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains sentry, code gate and barrier.
data.title: Egret

data.text:
Dhegdheer can host a single program.
Lower the install cost of programs you install on Dhegdheer by 1.
The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: Dhegdheer

data.flavor: Innovation. Iteration. Education.
data.title: Levy Advanced Research Lab
data.text: [click]: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may add 1 to your grip. Add the rest of the cards to the bottom of your stack in any order.

data.flavor: One of the wealthiest and most powerful areas of New Angeles, Laguna Velasco is also known as the Government District.
data.title: Laguna Velasco District
data.text: Whenever you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability), draw 1 additional card.

data.title: Process Automation
data.text: Gain 2[credit] and draw 1 card.
data.flavor: Restructuring labor resources.

data.text: [trash], 1[credit]: The Corp trashes 2 cards from HQ at random. Use this ability only if you suffered meat damage this turn.
data.title: Officer Frank

data.flavor: Although he rarely teaches classes these days, his lectures are always well attended.
data.title: Dean Lister
data.text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.

data.flavor: She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.
data.text: [trash]: Prevent 2 damage.
data.title: Biometric Spoofing

data.flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.
data.text: [click], forfeit an agenda: Play an event from your heap, ignoring all costs.
data.title: The Shadow Net

data.text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends [click] during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.
data.title: Seidr Laboratories: Destiny Defined
data.flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.

data.title: Brain Rewiring
data.text: When you score Brain Rewiring, you may pay X[credit] to force the Runner to add X cards from his or her grip to the bottom of his or her stack at random then draw 1 card.
data.flavor: The black level clearance sub-sub-basement of Haas-Bioroid is a magical place.

data.text: Place 2 agenda counters on Elective Upgrade when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Elective Upgrade

data.text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
data.title: Successful Field Test

data.text:
Whenever you install a card in a server, place 1 power counter on Estelle Moon.
[trash]: Draw 1 card and gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Estelle Moon.
data.title: Estelle Moon
Marilyn Campaign
data.text:
Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins.
If Marilyn Campaign is trashed while installed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives.

The Runner may spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Eli 2.0.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Eli 2.0
data.flavor: "A new game means new rules..."
"Strictly speaking, it isn't illegal to use an interrogation simulator as the blueprint for ICE." - Mason Bellamy
data.text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: Executive Functioning
Holmegaard
data.text: [subroutine] Trace 4 If successful, the runner cannot access any cards during this run. [subroutine] Trash 1 icebreaker. Errata from FAQ 4.0

data.flavor: "The Warp and Weft were hypnotic...but they didn't really seem to do anything to keep me out. But I never seemed to find anything interesting either." - Reaver
data.title: Tapestry
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp may add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click][click].
Gain 10[credit] and draw 4 cards. Install 1 card (paying all costs).
data.title: Ultraviolet Clearance
data.flavor: "If there were hidden partitions on the server, I'd know; I'm the head of this department!"

data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, the Runner must either take 1 brain damage or jack out. If the Runner jacks out, gain 5[credit], draw 1 card, and trash Black Level Clearance.
data.title: Black Level Clearance
data.flavor: Even knowing this floor existed was cause for termination...
"They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."
data.title: Mason Bellamy
data.text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.

data.flavor: Might makes right
data.text: Whenever a Runner card is trashed (from any location), you may force the Runner to remove it from the game instead of adding it to the heap. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Skorpios Defense Systems: Persuasive Power
Armored Servers
data.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Armored Servers when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: For the remainder of this run, the Runner must trash a card from his or her grip as an additional cost to jack out or break a subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.

data.flavor: "Anything, to anyone...for the right price."
data.title: Illicit Sales
data.text: When you score Illicit Sales, you may take 1 bad publicity. Gain 3[credit] for each bad publicity that you have.
When you score Graft, you may search your deck for up to 3 cards, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Graft
Illegal Arms Factory
data.text:
If the Runner trashes Illegal Arms Factory while it is installed, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.

data.title: Mr. Stone
data.text: Whenever the Runner takes 1 or more tags, do 1 meat damage.
data.flavor:
"VP of Retirements and Pensions? So is that HR or Accounting?"
"Both."

data.text: [subroutine] The Runner must either trash 1 program or trash the top 2 cards from his or her stack.
data.title: Bloodletter

data.text:
Colossus can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
If Colossus has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it).
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. (Give the Runner 2 tags.)
[subroutine] Trash 1 program. (Trash 1 program and 1 resource.)
data.title: Colossus

data.text:
[subroutine] Remove a card in the heap from the game.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Hailstorm

data.text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). [subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 4[credit].) [subroutine] End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0
data.title: Hortum
Hunter Seeker
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
Trash 1 card.

data.title: K. P. Lynn
data.text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.
When you score Paper Trail, Trace 6 If successful, trash all connection and job resources.
data.title: Paper Trail
Honeyfarm
data.text:
If Honeyfarm is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Honeyfarm, he or she loses 1[credit].

data.title: Long-Term Investment
data.text: When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Long-Term Investment. If there are at least 8[credit] on Long-Term Investment, it gains "[click]: Take any number of credits from Long-Term Investment."

data.title: Weir
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 card from his or her grip.

After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.

Gain 13[credit]
data.title: IPO

data.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
data.text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
data.title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter
Demolition Run
data.text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
data.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

data.title: Retrieval Run
data.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.

data.title: Singularity
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).

data.title: Stimhack
data.text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.

data.flavor: I feel almost naked without it
data.title: Cyberfeeder
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
+1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Spinal Modem

data.text:
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.
data.title: Darwin
Datasucker
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

data.flavor: It always strikes twice.
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Force of Nature
Imp
data.text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).
data.flavor: Something wicked this way comes.

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
data.title: Hemorrhage
data.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.

data.title: Mimic
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
data.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
data.title: Morning Star
data.text: 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.

data.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
data.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
data.title: Ice Carver

data.text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
data.title: Liberated Account
data.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
"They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
data.title: Scrubber
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.

data.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
data.title: Xanadu
data.text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.

data.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
data.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].

data.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
data.title: Easy Mark
data.text: Gain 3[credit].

data.title: Emergency Shutdown
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
data.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
data.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
data.title: Forged Activation Orders

data.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
data.title: Inside Job
data.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.

data.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
data.title: Special Order
data.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

data.flavor: Twice the fun.
data.text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Doppelgänger
HQ Interface
data.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
data.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.

data.text: 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: Aurora

data.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
data.text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
data.title: Faerie

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
data.title: Femme Fatale

data.text: 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: Peacock
data.flavor: Show-off.

data.title: Pheromones
data.text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.

data.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
data.title: Sneakdoor Beta
data.text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.

data.title: Bank Job
data.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

data.title: Crash Space
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
data.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.

There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
data.text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Fall Guy
Mr. Li
data.text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
data.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
"Have you met Dinosaurus?"
data.title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

data.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
data.text: Draw 3 cards.
data.title: Diesel

data.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
data.title: Indexing
Modded
data.text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
data.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: Notoriety
data.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.

data.title: Test Run
data.text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.

data.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
data.title: The Maker's Eye
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.

data.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
data.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
data.title: Tinkering

data.text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Dinosaurus

data.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
data.title: Rabbit Hole
data.text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.

data.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
data.title: The Personal Touch
data.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.

data.title: Battering Ram
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Gordian Blade

data.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
data.text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Magnum Opus
Pipeline
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

data.title: Aesop's Pawnshop
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
data.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
"I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
data.title: All-nighter
data.text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
[trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
data.title: Sacrificial Construct
data.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
"Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
data.text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
data.title: Infiltration
Sure Gamble
data.text: Gain 9[credit].
data.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

data.title: Dyson Mem Chip
data.text: +1[mu], +1[link]
data.flavor: Archaic but reliable.

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.

data.text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
data.title: Armitage Codebusting
data.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

data.title: Underworld Contact
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
data.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
A Different Breed of Machine.
data.text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
data.title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

data.text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Project Ares
data.flavor: Who wants to start a war?

data.title: Project Vitruvius
data.text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.

data.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
data.title: Aggressive Secretary

data.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
data.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.

The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

data.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
Whrrrrr!
data.text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.

[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.

data.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?

data.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
data.title: Archived Memories
data.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"

data.title: Biotic Labor
data.text: Gain [click][click].
data.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

data.text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.
data.title: Green Level Clearance
data.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.

data.title: Shipment from MirrorMorph
data.text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).
data.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

data.title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY
data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
data.flavor: "Eyes forward please."

data.title: Strongbox
data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
data.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
data.flavor: Moving Upwards.

data.text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Hostile Takeover
data.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

data.title: Project Atlas
data.text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

data.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
data.title: The Cleaners
data.text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.

data.title: Dedicated Response Team
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
data.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing

data.title: Elizabeth Mills
data.text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
data.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.

[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

data.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.

Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.

data.title: Beanstalk Royalties
data.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
"I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
data.text:
<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>

Shipment from Kaguya
data.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
data.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

data.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

data.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.

If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
data.title: Snare!

data.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
data.text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Himitsu-Bako

data.flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
data.title: Neural Katana
data.text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.

data.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
data.text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Swordsman
Wall of Thorns
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
"This ice sucks." -g00ru
data.title: Whirlpool
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.

data.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
data.title: Yagura
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
data.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.

data.title: Neural EMP
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
data.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
Smoke and mirrors optional.

data.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

data.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."

Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].

data.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

data.title: Tollbooth
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
"It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise

data.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

data.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

data.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

data.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

data.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.

data.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

data.title: Private Security Force
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."
data.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."

data.title: Melange Mining Corp.
data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].
data.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
It is like the one you just bought, only better.

data.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"

data.title: Wall of Static
data.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
data.title: Hedge Fund
data.text: Gain 9[credit].

data.title: Lewi Guilherme
data.text:
When your turn begins, either lose 1[credit] or trash Lewi Guilherme.
The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
data.flavor: Brought up in the slums of Jinja, Lewi made his fortune through back alley deals, well-placed bets, and savvy showmanship.

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Upya. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Upya
data.flavor: New life through new understanding.

"The average citizen of Nairobi speaks six languages.  Every culture, language, and ethnicity of the east of Africa collides here, collapses together.  What happens slowly by nature can happen quickly in our lab.  We will bring peace." - Dr. Muchina, Project Lead
data.text: As an additional cost to steal Ikawah Project, the Runner must spend [click] and 2[credit].
data.title: Ikawah Project
Gene Splicer
data.text: Gene Splicer can be advanced. When the runner accesses Gene Splicer, do 1 net damage for each advancement token on Gene Splicer. [click], 3 advancement tokens: Add Gene Splicer to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

data.title: Echo Chamber
data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Add Echo Chamber to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.flavor: "Capitalism runs on two things: amplified arrogance and censored dissent.  With those, a corp can create any environment it wants." - Freedom Khtemalo

data.title: Urban Renewal
data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Urban Renewal when it is rezzed.  When there are no power counters left on Urban Renewal, trash it and do 4 meat damage.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Urban Renewal.
Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, you may gain 1[credit] for each virus counter removed and trash Acacia.
data.title: Acacia
data.flavor: The system is so deeply rooted, who knows how far the cables run?

data.text: Whenever you draw a piece of ice, you may reveal it and install it protecting this server, lowering the install cost by 4[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Jinja City Grid
data.flavor: "The site of the world's second beanstalk, or I'll die trying." - Mirja Byanyima, Director of VSEP

data.title: Bacterial Programming
data.text: When Bacterial Programming is scored or stolen, you may look at the top 7 cards of R&D, add any number of them to HQ, trash any number of them, and arrange the rest in any order.

Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
The Runner loses 4[credit], if able.
data.title: Economic Warfare
data.flavor: He found it odd that three frozen yogurt shops, all less than a block from his, opened within the same week.

data.title: SSL Endorsement
data.text:
When SSL Endorsement is scored or stolen, place 9[credit] from the bank on it.
When the Corp's turn begins, he or she may take 3[credit] from SSL Endorsement. This ability is active even while SSL Endorsement is in the Runner's score area.
